Reviews.Title: Terrible Customer Service, TV Stopped Working While In Warranty and They Will Not Replace It
Reviews.Author: amazon girl
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in May 2012. Around October/November 2012, it started going crazy. First, the screen would freeze and turn various solid colors or display lines and then shut down. Samsung took over 2 weeks to repair this problem. Basically, their repair company out in NJ couldn't be bothered to show up to 3 appointments so eventually Samsung agreed to send me a local technician. He fixed the problem but then new problems began where the TV couldn't stay on for more than 3 seconds without continuously restarting. Another repair ticket was issued and the TV has to be serviced again. I haven't been able to use the TV for over a week and am waiting on Samsung to send the technician the right part. Samsung is refusing to replace the TV and I can only imagine what other problems this TV is going to have. Based on my experience dealing with Samsung, I would say just don't take the risk and order from another manufacturer. The TV is beautiful but the hassle I have had to go through to get Samsung to keep their end of the bargain in their warranty is just not worth it. I may as well have thrown this money down the toilet because the amount of days I have had to take off from work and my family's inability to enjoy the TV over the holidays can not be rectified at this point.

Reviews.Title: Incredible!
Reviews.Author: S. Switzer
Reviews.Content: We had an old LCD Sony XBR, and this picture blows it away... the clarity is stunning. I compared this TV with the Samsung 8000, 7100, and the 6500. It's all about contrast ratio... the 8000 is 30 million to one. The 7500 is 25 mil. to one, the 7100 is 20 mil. to one, and the 6500 is 5 mil. to one. Comparing side by side, the 7500 and 8000 are close, but a few hundred dollars apart.... the 7500 and 7100 are close, but only $200 dollars apart, go for the 7500. The 6500 is quite a bit cheaper, but does not compare in picture quality to the 7500, hands down. The 7500 contrast is absolutely stunning, the colors much more vibrant. I compared these two for weeks at different stores, the pictures aren't even close. Go for the 7500. The black levels are insane, I can't say enough about this picture.Another comparison to the 6500; the 7500 in Standard picture mode, looks the same as the 6500 in Vivid mode. And because you shouldn't run a television continually in Vivid, is another great reason to buy the 7500.Something else to consider, a sales guy told me, even though I really didn't care too much about 3D, televisions with 3D have a much better processor and will look better in 2D as well.Keep in mind... this TV has a really clear front panel, almost like glass. This clear panel (v/s a matte panel) will not bend the light that is emitted, so the clarity is insane. The downfall is, a lot of glare. Samsung puts a special tint on the screen to try and tone down the glare, but it's still there. I happen to have a fairly bright north facing window opposite my TV, and while it is annoying during the day, it is just spectacular at night... well worth the inconenience during daytime viewing, but something to consider.As for the smart features... they work OK, but you'll need a really fast connection to the internet, standard DSL by Wi-Fi is unacceptable. If you're buying this TV for the Smart features, you may be disappointed... if you buy it for it's picture, you'll be blown away night after night.As for the sound, the speakers are really small, but if you adjust the equalizer just right, it's actually acceptable. While it's not great, I was pleasantly surprised. The only time we use the TV speakers is for the news or a quick program, otherwise it's pumped thru the receiver amp.Another suggestion.... no matter where you buy your TV, you can purchase the Square Trade 3 year warranty at Costco. A really cool benefit, that even the folks at Costco didn't know about... read the warranty at the desk, it states right on it. So for $99, you get a 3 year warranty AFTER the one year Samsung warranty, for a total of 4 years!This TV is just a blast to operate, and really is smart... If you pop a DVD in the Blu-ray player, the TV comes on automatically, changes the video input to DVD, and begins to play all by itself... Just write the check... you're going to love it!!!

Reviews.Title: A Window Into Another World
Reviews.Author: J. fox
Reviews.Content: This TV is superb.  Its so colorful, clear and thin that the image looks like its floating.  Its like looking through a window.  I did have to take some time and read some forums on which settings to use, but once I calibrated this TV correctly I was blown away.  If you are not into that sort of thing, here is an easy place to start:  put the TV into movie mode, turn the backlight down to 8-10, contrast down to 85-90, and motion plus to 'clear'.  Play around from there and you'll find your sweet spot.I also found the internet features/apps to be faster than any other TV I have tried.  Searching and watching HD clips on YouTube is fast, easy, and glitch free.  You may want to invest in a wireless keyboard, but for me the remote worked fine.3D mode is excellent as well.  It comes with four pairs of 3D glasses.  Images a clear, with minimum ghosting and the pop out effect on certain scenes is truly a sight to be hold.  Everyone I've shown this TV too has loved it and said its the nicest looking set they've seen.  I agree.The motion and touch controls work well, if you are not an idiot (no offense).  I've seen some videos where people can't seem to get it to work, and I have to say its all on the individual not the TV.  If you speak clearly (don't yell or mumble) the TV responds.  The camera works well too.  I don't use these features much but its nice to know they are there and work.The only negative is the speakers.  I use a surround system anyway, but there was a time where my speakers were not hooked up (after I moved) and the speakers are too quiet at 10W.  My feeling is if you are in the market for this type of TV you most likely have a good audio system anyway.One final note.  My PS3 games look and play great with no noticeable lag.  As expected blurays look phenomenal. My advice if you are in the market for a new TV and are considering this one, get it.

Reviews.Title: Too many flaws for the price
Reviews.Author: Koplaw
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful TV.  However, there are just too many flaws.  To begin with, the internet apps would not work.  The menu confirmed I was connected to the internet, but nothing would work.  Many hours on the phone with Samsung led to nothing but frustration.  After going through every menu, I tried doing a manual software update.  It worked, but who knows for how long.  The picture is stunning, the 3D is great.  However, the sound is terrible.  I mean really bad.  Like you are listening in a tin can.  Also, the tv delevloped motion blur.  I think another reviewer said it was like a little jump every so often.  The picture is just so wonderful, I was going to let it go.  But for the price, you really should not have to learn to deal with the flaws.  Unfortunatately, this one is going back.  I have always been a loyal Samsung customer. This will be my last Samsung.  The customer service told me to unplug the TV, wait a minute, and plug it back in.  When that didn't work, they told me that was all they had, no one else could help. I should wait for the update which will fix it - it is coming out in several months! Seriously?  Samsung, you really need to get your act together on this one.

Reviews.Title: Just gorgeous and well-conected too
Reviews.Author: D. P. Maher
Reviews.Content: Basics:Video is outstanding. Standard 2D is as good as I have seen. I did not expect to even try the 3D, but I noticed in the MediaHub app you can stream some IMAX 3D content. That was just amazing. I am a convert. The 2D to 3D conversions are not bad, but necessarily much more limited than the native 3D. Watching the IMAX 3D underwater content was like looking into a huge aquarium. Truly awesome. Over time more of that kind of content will be available and I think the 3D is worth it for documentaries, nature, and like content. The glasses were not as much of a hassle as I thought, and you get 4 pairs.Sound is as good as any native TV sound system I have heard. Worthwhile playing with the audio settings, as there are some optimizations for dialog clarity, virtual surround, and an equalizer. We use this TV in two modes: A quiet mode where we just use the native audio, and "big room" mode where we use our external setup. Its nice to have decent native audio that is tunable. A toslink cable quickly connected the TV to our existing audio setup.Controls and setup:Setup was painless. No issues. I kept the voice and motion controls off to begin with, as I expected those to take awhile to set up. I was able to connect android tablet and iphone remote apps very easily. The best of these is an iphone app called myTifi remote. It was useful for typing in all of the account names and passwords for Skype, Amazon, Netflix, and Samsung accounts. The set comes with two Samsung remotes. The main one is really not that bad at all. Then there is a second "smart remote" that has a built-in trackpad. Its nowhere near as good as a trackpad or touchscreen on a phone, but not bad for mousing around on the smart TV screen. I also connected a Logitech wireless touch K400 keyboard placing the dongle in one of the TV's USB ports. It was recognized immediately by the Samsung TV setup menu. Even when I am watching TV, I can wakeup the Samsung menu system from the Logitech touchpad on the keyboard, getting a cursor, and then I can click and get a smart TV menu or a setup menu. We are not yet in the era of seamless integration of computers and TVs, however, as the keyboard does not work with the 3rd party apps. It does work with the built-in browser, but in a klunky kind of way: you can type in text to the browser, but the browser still brings up an onscreen keyboard obscuring part of the screen. Oh well.Internet:Samsung probably has as many TV apps as anyone except Sony. One app I miss from the Sony Blueray device (in another room) is the Berlin Philharmonic streaming app. Watching concerts with this app is wonderful since the camerawork is just first rate, and the sound is superb. But, Skype works well, and the Skype video in particular works really well. Lots of content-oriented apps like Amazon, Youtube, Amazon, etc. plus some 3D samplers. The browser is OK and useful with a keyboard. There is lots of room for improvement, but like in the case of gesture controls, this will take time for the whole Industry. Samsung has done a good job here. I can't grade them down until someone else (maybe apple) comes out with something better."Advanced features"The voice and gesture controls of this set are a work in progress, for sure. I have evaluated a number of these technologies in my professional life over the year. I applaud Samsung for diving into this, but it is just not ready for prime time, as many have commented. I refuse to grad the product down for that, at this point. I have not heard of any TV manufacturer doing a better job at this. You could say why introduce the features before they are perfected? But I think it is useful to get these features out there and get experience with them from many users. If you don't want to be bothered with such "bleeding-edge" technology implementations, just leave them turned off. In this case I don't blame you and I join you. That said, I think for many the voice control will be useful. I suspect it will work OK for many people.The set is DLNA compatible, and includes an "all-share" proprietary networking capability. If you use a lot of Samsung devices (like their phones and tablets) it will work nicely, so you can stream content to it from those phones quite easily.The TV found my nexus tablet and all of the content on it, and played it without issue. I mostly use apple stuff, but I tried an iphone app called imedia share that works well, and there is an android and called "Play to Samsung TV" which I used to expose my android media files to the TV . None of this is as smooth as apple airplay, so of you value this capability just get an apple TV puck. But there will soon be competition for airplay.Summary:While this is not the top-of-the-line Samsung TV, this one has an amazing amount of technology and is over the air upgradeable. It will get better (and there is even a hardware slot on the back for hardware upgrades, though I doubt I will be using that). The basics are terrific, and connectivity is as good as anything I have seen. It is fun to play around with the voice and gesture controls, but don't expect much at this point. It will get better.

Reviews.Title: UN46ES7500 - All my HDMI ports DO NOT work!
Reviews.Author: Smokey the Cat
Reviews.Content: UN46ES7500 - All my HDMI ports DO NOT work!Very frustrated, only had this tv for 2 weeks..None of the HDMI ports no longer work...The HDMI cables are ok...my sources like my cable box, bluray player and ps3 all work on other HDTVs i own as well..I did a factory reset like the manual states, still nothing...also I have the latest firmware...Now I have to return it for a replacement...very very frustrating and upsetting..Ill keep UPDATING this, what a nightmare...so much for being a SMART tv...its a pretty "DUMB" one if all HDMI ports dont even work...HAS ANYONE HERE EXPERIENCED THIS HDMI PORT PROBLEM? PLEASE LET ME KNOW...UPDATED: OCTOBER 22nd, 2012I got the identical set replaced by amazon, so far its been perfect, no problems at all, except for all the hassle of sending everything back to amazon. This 7500 & 8000 Series by Samsung is one of the most tech packed HDTV's out there, great all around... BUT no support for AMAZON PRIME VIDEO, wassup with that amazon & samsung, fix this already...lolUPDATED: JAN. 15TH 2013finally support for amazon prime video with full 5.1 DD/DTS discreet surround sound....

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it.. it worth less
Reviews.Author: RadhaK
Reviews.Content: This TV disappointed me badly.Two months back I purchased this TV and within first week my TV is not starting and I called samsung customer care. They told to replace the TV.And I replaced and got the second one. After using for 1 month this TV is getting horizontal lines and it is restarting automatically, not able to switch off with remote. So I unplugged and try to go to smart hub and the problem again happened.I frustrated and called amazon support to Return. They are going to refund the money.The TV is too costly but not worth to put that much amount for these type of issues.I have no problem with the features..features are great but if TV is getting lines nothing we can do.Be Aware before buying this.

Reviews.Title: Nice!! Beautiful picture quality! BUT...
Reviews.Author: Weld Tech
Reviews.Content: UPDATE Review June 3rd 2012:After updating to the latest firmware, I've noticed the jitter, stuttering in playback is much less than before. Still leaving at 3 stars..since I should not see any of it.Factory reset didn't help either, every so often, a sputter is seen.Tried the gesture / motion control. LAME. Seem to not work too well, especially in dim to dark rooms. Even with good lighting, after setup the hand motion control is gimmicky at best. Could not get it to start again, by just waving my hand (like the manual states). Took too much effort / time, easier to use remote.Voice control is kinda neat, but still needs work. I found that using the universal remote with it's mike is better. Cannot turn on the TV with it though (though voice command).The universal remote seems to only control set top boxes (cable, satellite), DVD / Bluray players. Cannot control my external sound bar or WD media player. When programming it, you don't input codes (like in the past), you choose by make, model then data is sent to the universal remote and the IR blaster. The IR Blaster needs to remain on (uses 4 AA batteries - supplied), to be able to control the other devices.UPDATE May 26th 2012:Downgrading to 3 stars do to this anomaly:After nearly 1 week with this TV, (and it started 1 day of using it) I've noticed jitter (like a pausing) in the playback of video (through Uverse HD cable, or through a Media Player - WD media player live plus, even the bluray player). Odd thing, when I first got it, I set up the TV (turning on the anti blur stuff) and other settings for color, contrast, brightness, etc. Looked great. For around 8 hours, not a jitter, sputter in picture. The next day is when the jitter anomalies started. I read another user had this, he turned down the anti jitter setting (didn't say to what level, looks like the anti blur and jitter each have a range from 1 to 10 - the default is already factory set at 5 each). My settings were at 7 each, on my first day with this TV and without issues.So, when seeing these video jitters the next day, reading about it, I turned mine down to the original settings of 5 (anti blur and jitter). I still saw the issues. I turned off the motion LED, then turned off the MPEG smoothing (more anti blur technology), still issues. I actually did a reset of the anti blur / jitter settings (TV has a reset in that area), did not help. Disconnected TV from power strip conditioner for about 20 minutes, viewed TV again, still same issues.Dunno..maybe I have a lemon TV? It's noticeable, this anomaly. Around every 5 to 10 minutes, this jitter occurs for about 1 second (it's quick when it happens but definitely noticeable). Frustrating, concerning..that my 2000.00 dollar TV may be a troubled and or badly engineered product.IF YOU GET THIS TV, ensure that you do so from a company that will allow a return without any restock fees and enough time (30 days?) to evaluate it.One thing I did notice on unpacking this TV. The white Styrofoam type of covering on the TV was loosely placed on it, no tape. No clear plastic you'd normally see on the TV's screen was present. The base coupler device (the plastic that screws into the swivel base and then into the TV) that coupler's plastic bag was already opened. This TV may have been a demo or a return even though the TV's box was sealed (hmmm..paulstv reselling as new? - stay away from them as they also have a 15 % restock fee).Anyone have comments on how their TV was packed? Or any jitter / sputtering of their picture? Any settings ideas? Please post comments. Thanks!---------------------------Edited original review:Has USB input(I think 2 of them) for mem stick. I think it can read files from a hard drive (not too sure). Not tried this yet, not sure I want to in case of corruption to my HDD's files.Has digital audio output. I think an analog output too. Can run TV speakers with the digital audio output at the same time.GREAT picture, blacks are dark, whites are white. NO light BLEEDING on the sides, anywhere. LOTS of tweak settings for the picture.240 HZ refresh rate (has a very high CMR - clear motion rate at 840 - helps with fast video, less blur, so they say..). From what I've seen, I do see some blur on fast video, but nothing short of near perfection.Has 24p cinema playback, supposedly to "smooth" movies to what you may see in a movie theater. Its auto selected, if player's output is 24p, then TV plays in that mode.Built in wifi, works well, seen my Uverse router without issue (WEP key security, no issues connecting).5 band EQ for sound setting for the TV's speakers (which sound OK, but not great..acceptable).Thin TV, but is that really a plus? This TV is kind of heavy, around 40 LBS I think. The thinness makes the speakers lack good/great sound, only offering good sound.Thin bezel (frame) so it can fit in smaller spaces than other models.Has some type of way to play videos/music/pictures from a PC that's on the same network (DNLA most likely). The mpg video I tried to play..."the file you've selected is not currently supported". *sigh*4 pairs of 3D glasses (20.00 specials seen here on amazon). They work well. Using the typical nickle size, flat batteries (supplied).Will play 2D movies in 3D (from any source: cable, bluray, dvd, media players). Can convert 3D to 2D if desired.Can set 3D depth and 3D quality settings, to avoid "blurred" 3D (but will suffer in the 3D depth when doing so). If you can set it to high, the 3D looks amazing.Has a swivel base, can tilt TV to the left or right about 10 degrees or so.CONS:NO VGA, or DVI input seen on this TV (I've seen some sites claiming this TV has a VGA input). Should have 4 HDMI inputs (especially for this price!!).Has web browser but not like a PC...limited on what it can do.NO Crackle?? C'mon! So, I used the web browser to go to crackle.com. Yay, I'm there. Selected movie and ..."Express install is not supported by this operating system".  *SIGH*  Well that sux, can't play crackle movies. If this TV runs in Linux, then it may be a long time / never, when Adobe updates flash player for Linux (see Boxee box issues).Speakers don't sound as good as my previous, thicker TV (samsung un40eh5000) that I had, but that's what my sound bar is for. But, they are most acceptable.Doesn't seem to offer near as much smart apps as Panasonic models.Conclusion:Overall, great picture quality and with great 3D, with some added features that do not reliably seem to work.

Reviews.Title: Voice and motion control useless
Reviews.Author: H. Reed "Asheville Man"
Reviews.Content: Update: 5/29/12Upon some "Good" advice we kept this TV past the 30 day return window in order to do an update of the software that was supposed to "Fix" the voice recognition feature.  We have now done two update revisions from Samsung and there is very little improvement.  So little that we are not sure if it is really improved or we are just feeling so bad for ending up stuck with this TV that we are trying to imagine some improvement.  No matter how clearly you enunciate your words, softly or loudly you speak you can't get the TV to even turn on more than 25% of the time and there is just no predictability in how it responds.  And it more often turns on for no reason with no one in a very quiet room than it will with you speaking to it.  At this point we are just trying to make the most of it and hoping that Samsung gets their act together and gets this working in a future software update.Previous review:We are so dissapppointed with this TV.  While the picture is great and the sound is really good given the ultra thin cabinet we really bought this TV for the promise of not needing to always have a remote in hand.  The motion control only works at the brightest times of the day and the voice command feature is useless from any distance greater than about 5 feet.  The microphone on the remote apparently doesn't work or is just as deaf as the mic on the TV.  So unless you sit within 5 feet of a 46 inch TV voice command is not for you.The remote is not sensitive enough and unpredictable in how the touch control interprets your movements.  Entering text in the web application is agonizingly slow and tedious.  I am seriously considering returning this TV and getting the same picture quality version from last year which will save me several hundred dollars and give me a better remote.What a dissappointment!  Maybe in a few more years they will get this right.

Reviews.Title: tv on and off
Reviews.Author: Nelson Ponte
Reviews.Content: EnglishThe first two months everything right, but then the tv turns off and turns on it, constantly restarts.I live in Venezuela, and Samsung here tells me they can not do anything because they have nothing to do with what you buy in the U.S., even Samsung.You can help me in any way? are responsible for this? because research on the internet and this problem is common in smart tv made ​​by you, you should be taking responsibility for this problem and help your client.I appreciate what you can help me.PONTE NELSONEspañolLos primeros 2 meses todo bien, pero luego el tv se apaga y prende el mismo, se reinicia constantemente.Yo vivo en venezuela, y Samsung aqui me dice que no pueden hacer nada porque no tienen nada que ver con lo que compre en USA, aunque sea Samsung.Ustedes me pueden ayudar de alguna forma? se hacen responsables por esto? porque investigue en internet y este problema es comun en los tv smart fabricados por de ustedes, deberia ser responsabilidad de ustedes asumir este problema y ayudar a su cliente.Agradezco de antemano en lo que me puedan ayudar.NELSON PONTE

Reviews.Title: 3 month review
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV about 3 months ago. You may wonder why it has taken me so long to write a review? I wanted to wait and not make any haste decisions.- Upon receiving the TV it was very easy to setup and and the basic instructions was all I required.- The TV picture for both 2D and 3D is FABULOUS at 1920 x 1080 for the high definition broadcast from Comcast. The Wi-Fi and camera work excellent. The speakers are not to shabby either. I would recommend this TV to people interested in a high end, high quality TV.So why the 4 stars and not five. There is certainly some things Samsung can do better.1) The web page by Samsung for support is not intuitive at all and once you finally find a document the explanation for the most part is terrible. I spent many hours at this site looking for some answers.2) The hand movement function on the TV is useless. Tried lots of different locations and lighting and for the most part it occasionally worked.3) Voice recognition is nice, but it would be nice to be able to train it to respond to your commands. Tried changing channels with voice command and hardly ever gets the numbers correct. Tried changing the source with voice commands and that works about 50% of the time. This is a nice feature to play with, but I believe Samsung can make it 100% better.4) When using smart hub or samsung aps the current controls supplied are very time consuming to use. Going to the web with out a keyboard and mouse will be very painful.I believe Samsung will continue to improve the above mentioned problems. I love the idea that I can download software updates to enhance and improve features. What Samsung needs to do when updating the TV is to supply a list of what was fixed and what enhancements were added. I believe this could be done with a white paper opened on the screen after they download and install the upgrade. I feel it is important to know what is happening to my tv.

Reviews.Title: Funny line in screen for my Samsung UN46ES7500 TV
Reviews.Author: SRJ
Reviews.Content: I love the TV, but have recently noticed a white vertical line appearing on the screen.  Anyone else having this issue?

Reviews.Title: Sharp picture / decent price
Reviews.Author: techfan
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is superb.  The small bezel makes the picture seem like its floating in air.  The interpolation of frames is odd at times, with some motion appearing unnaturally fluid.  Also, I've noticed some flicker on fine details.  The elimination of an HDMI port (3 versus 4 in previous models) is unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: UN46ES7500
Reviews.Author: StorageKing74
Reviews.Content: Here's the real deal on this TV.  The picture is awesome and I'm fully satisfied with the purchase.  Here is why it got 4 stars and why it didn't get 5.Setup:DirectTV STBPS3 hookedYamaha YAS-101 soundbarMy Yamaha only has optical inputs so I plugged the audio directly from the STB and PS3 to the soundbar.  The Samsung TV does not pass through Dolby Digital.  I digress... this is about the TV.Picture:Fantastic picture.  It does need to be calibrated to your liking so you can pull that up on the internet.  I like to watch my Bluray/DVD movies in the movie setting and turning off all the effects.  On regular TV channels, I like the automotion to be there and the screen to be a little more bright.  Make sure you calibrate it as blu ray movies can look awful if left untouched.Sound:What do you expect from a thin TV?  Sure you can hear stuff but it's like getting hubcaps with your ferrari.  Put in the extra monies for a sound system.. at minimum a soundbar.Design:Whooa.. it's pretty.  I have a cabinet and this is the biggest TV I could fit in it.  Thank goodness Samsung makes super slim frames.  It's like looking through a window.Features and function:This is where it falls short.  While using it like a regular TV.. it's great.  Turns on quickly and works just the way you want it to.  The funky part is with the "smart" features.  Voice and motion control is a joke.  It's not ready for prime time.  The TV would sometimes turn off out of nowhere.  Voice commands work but they don't work when you want them to, unless you're standing in the right position.  They also include two remotes.. why?  It's really no use.  They try to tell you that you can use their remote for your devices.  If you're like me and I bet a lot of people, you use a set top box from cable or SAT... and you own a DVR.  How can you access your Guide or DVR list.  You can't.. deeming this remote to be useless.  After I programmed it to my DirectTV remote I was all set.Conclusion:This is hands down a great TV.  It does seem like Samsung was trying to push its new features out too early to get ahead of the competition.  I'm not sure if anyone is buying the TV for these functions.. if you are.. you'll feel that there is a lot left to be desired.Tip: For you extended warranty purchasers, it's better to buy it from Costco.  You can buy the squaretrade warranty at a cheaper price and it will start after the Samsung warranty.

Reviews.Title: UN55ES7500
Reviews.Author: shsat001
Reviews.Content: Have had it for 2 months. No problems found what so ever. amazing picture quality. The voice and video commands are useless as is the touch remote. But that's not what I bought the TV for. The internet portion of TV is quite fast and reliable. I recommend the TV and amazon purchase fully.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TVs lack software and hardware quality
Reviews.Author: Ran123
Reviews.Content: Pros :Cool featuresCons:Sub par hardware, buggy firmwareUpdated : Returned the replacement TV as well. -:(  . The picture just went so dark that I could hardly see peoples faces. Tried resetting everything to factory settings, still no luck.Last Samsung product I would ever buy.After updating the firmware, every time I try to switch off the Tv, I get a message saying that "The TV is updating Camera" firmware. The Samsung technician came home and even he couldn't fix the issue. The answer from Samsung tech support " This is normal" behavior for the TV to display that message. I said, what the **. I asked Amazon for a replacement. Waiting for the replacement to see if that also has the same problem. If it repeats, I am returning the TV for good. If you look through the other reviews for this TV, you could see that several people are complaining about Samsung's TV software bugs. My advice to other fellow Amazon shoppers :" Please read through the reviews thoroughly before you commit to this huge investment".

Reviews.Title: Great in the daytime, terrible night viewing
Reviews.Author: Rob P
Reviews.Content: I *really* wanted to love this TV, and that's what makes writing such a negative review so hard.The problem is these TVs suffer from horrendous clouding issues, to the point where the clouding is visible when watching movies in a darkened room.My 2010 Sony Bravia 2010 Edge Lit TV had better dark performance than the Samsung.Contacted support and they are adamant in suggesting that the TV's performance is normal and clouding is a by product of the technology - they won't even swap out my set with another.I've uploaded the picture of clouding to the user images for this product - hopefully it can prevent people making the same mistake in buying this TV if they intend to watch movies in a dark environment.To sum up positives:- The feature set is fantastic- Smart tv is brilliant- Daytime picture is greatMASSIVE NEGATIVE:- Trying to watch the thing in a room with the lights off is impossible. All you will see is clouding.- Support while friendly enough won't swap out on clouding issues. This must be a directive from Samsung and makes the warranty essentially worthless.

Reviews.Title: save some money and get it.
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: The description said there may be marls or scratches on the back, as I'm not spending my time looking at the back I got it. there are no marks anywhere on this and you would never tell I didn't pay full price for it at any major electrical retailer.

Reviews.Title: Deserves 4 stars.. coz., i had to buy additional accessory
Reviews.Author: Mohammed K. Shariff "ka ka"
Reviews.Content: TV Model : UN46ES7500Picture quality:i have not seen such clear picture in any TV. hig quality ..3D :pop out effect is less.. i have observed the difference with Sony TV... IMAX videos always have the pop out effect this worked very good in sonybut Samsung has the depth.. it is more real... which is better..smart hub :Initially when i setup the smart hub..it had lot of issues .. apps get uninstalled automatically and setting up of facebook app was pain.. Samsung support will not help setup facebook for you..i figured it out how to setup facebook on samsung TV.. thanks to google search.Smart hub is now stable... and if u find any issue., raise a incident to samsung support they may release a new firmware update.. this is something which is cooland one more thing i liked most in samsung TV is .. SAMSUNG support can login to your TV from remote and correct the issue.. which is awesome.connectivity :It is very easy to connect to internet .. the setup will automatically detect the nearby WIFI .. yes it has buit in WIFI. connecting USB ,external hard disk and laptop to the TV was not at all a problem...mouse control and remote control :pathetic.. it takes lot of time to adjust using this remote... and the smart remote is just a waste handling is not so easy.. i do not use it at all.i am planning to buy an additional accessory for this .. a bluethooth keyboard with touchpad.  -- this is the only reason why i gave 4 stars.While it is good to have Guesture and voice control i have not used it... but sounds cool to have a TV with all these options.overall it is good buy.. fancy smart hub, guesture, voice control..

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: DanD
Reviews.Content: I chose this TV after reading many reviews and i am very pleased with the picture; especially the 3D. The sound quality is  as you read in many of the reviews of the Led TVs; not the best.I am still getting familiar with the other functions of the TV.I would recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: Humberto Rondon
Reviews.Content: a spectacular tv, a very good investment, the definition is excellent, the 3d is perfect, together Blue ray 3D samsung the best combination

Reviews.Title: Interface Comments & Update
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung UN46ES7500 Smart TV and found that it does not support the Amazon.com application.  Hence if you are planning to use the TV to access Amazon Prime streaming videos you will not be able to.  I called Samsung support and Samsung indicated that they are still working with Amazon on the Amazon application but that they do not expect to have that App working until about January 15, 2013.  If you are keen on having access to Amazon video streaming I would wait on your purchase until Samsung says that the Amazon applications is supported.  I have not tried to access any other App like Netflix or Roku for example, but I am worried that they may not work either.  I have only had the TV for 5 days.The TV itself was easy to setup and the video is great.  The Web browsing application works, but it is tedious and time consuming to use.  This Smart TV needs to go back to school and get smarter so it can support a real keyboard and mouse.  I have a computer in the same room as the TV, but my wife need the larger screen because of her poor eyesight.  A real keyboard and mouse would help significantly.  I have not tried a direct connection between my computer and the TV using a HDMI cable - perhaps that will work.  Suggestions are welcome.I talked with Amazon's technical support about the Amazon app this evening 1/2/2013 and Daniel from technical support was able to identify the issue with the Samsung App for Amazon.  He found internally a note that the Samsung app for Amazon was recently updated and suggested that I reload the TV's software.  I followed Daniels advice and reloaded the TV's software and the update was successful.  I am now watching streaming videos in HD as an Amazon prime customer.  Thanks for the excellent support!!

Reviews.Title: Astounding picture
Reviews.Author: John E Hines
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazed at picture quality. Set up not as easy as i had hoped. (Iam technology challenged). Lots of help thru coustomer service. I have no complaints with this T.V. Big box super store. excellent seller.

Reviews.Title: tv is not worth the price
Reviews.Author: Merit shata
Reviews.Content: Although the pictures was great, the sound was usually low. Also the wireless connection to the Internet is inefficient with repeated disconnect . After 6 months the Tv suddenly begins to turn it on and off and the pictures disappeared with the appearance of colored lines instead. I called the customer service  3 times and after 10 days the service guy ordered the repair part even without seeing the TV which indicated for me that it is a common problem in this TV and Samsung is aware of the problem. the service technician should come tomorrow to fix the TV. this the first time I had TV which required service within 6 months although I had before less expensive TV like white Westinghouse

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: torres
Reviews.Content: that's the item I was looking for, great staff. I like it very much,the item is as described from the seller. 4stars because the price has changed suddenly without notices and I had to pay the new price but now the price has gone down again. torres

Reviews.Title: It's like a 46" Galaxy S4 !!!
Reviews.Author: Rubab Khan
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectation before the units arrived, but it easily met and beat all my expectations easily.First, the packaging was great. The usual TV box was put in a much lager brown box and packed very carefully and with a lot of protection. Not a scratch anywhere inside.Next, setting up was quick and easy. After connecting to the net, the TV took about half an hour to update everything, and I had to access most of teh features in Smart Hub one at a time to update everything, but that's okay. It is not much different than first time turning on a laptop or Smart phone.Then, it paired without any complaints with both my HTC one and my wife's S4 without any complaint. In fact, my friend brought over an iPhone just to see if Apple plays well with Samsung here, and it did! All you have to do is to search for "Samsung smart" in any app store for all the great free apps.Finally, cough up a few bucks for a  few extra apps, and your world will become perfect.BTW, although getting a wireless keyboard may seem like a good idea, since the on screen keyboard is annoying, you shouldn't bother about that if you have a smart phone.=====Verdict:Best smart TV and Best value. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46-inch UN 46ES7500, awesome TV.
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: We love the bezel on this TV, just outstanding. The picture range is so fine-tuned, but there is a lot of glare. For phones they have those clear plastic films to keep the glare off, they should do that for TVs as well.We also purchased the 6500 for our bedroom, they are equally amazing.Overall, it's stunning. The choice really boils down to your budget and if you are going to watch 50% of your movies in 3D all the time to make it really worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I loved this TV as I do so many other Samsung product but did return due to glare off the screen, no matter where I placed it I always had issues with reflections from items in the room

Reviews.Title: Geat Product - very EZ to set up
Reviews.Author: Damien Philibert "DPP"
Reviews.Content: This is a great product, very EZ to set up. the remote control is fine and it is very cool to us this TV for Skype vision conference

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46ES7500 46-inch 1080p 240Hz Slim LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: J. Gregory Wright
Reviews.Content: Love this TV!! Purchased it to replace a damage TV. Had purchased two other Samsungs prior to adding this one to our family of TV's. Contract, clarity, color saturation, and resolution all good. The only issue is that even at 240Hz, sports action is blurred/pixelated at the tip of the ball (NFL & NCAAF). Not a deal breaker for me but  personally, I think the best option for smooth, fast action sports is plasma. This TV has video chat capabilities but I have not hooked it up to the Internet so I cannot address its functionality in this rating. Good value and would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46ES7500 46-inch
Reviews.Author: Art
Reviews.Content: I baought it as used from Amazon. It works perfectly. Delivery was on time. Only has very little dent on the back that is not easily noticable. main con was that it came with noe screws to attach it to the stand that came with it. Quality of picture is excellent. It works perfect and no issues or complain. It started working the minute I pluged it in.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: James "Big fan of fantasy and sci fi! I love ...
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that I don't have cable. I use this TV for Primarily, Netflix, Hulu, Blu-Ray and my PS3. The netflix and hulu I used are the apps that come installed with the TV, both work and look great. My PS3 games look great as do any blu ray/blu-ray 3D movies I play on it.The 3D glasses that came with the TV work well. Small and functional and you can find replacements online for $20 if ever needed (thought I haven't need any yet I checked to see what they would cost me.)There are surprisingly a lot of apps that are available for this SMART tv, including Netflix, Hulu, Facebook, Pandora. Its even got a "work out" app. Overall I am very happy with this purchase.I am not going to get in the picture quality comparison that other people write about other than to say the picture is great, and everyone who visits and watches my TV mentions how "clear" it is.If you are looking for a great Smart TV with great looks and great picture quality look no further.

Reviews.Title: Just Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Max Alvarado
Reviews.Content: I love this TV, the 3D is great and all the options I have for applications. Very easy to configure and completly HD.

Reviews.Title: Quality Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: CAL 15
Reviews.Content: I was shopping around for a replacement TV that had a great picture and smart functions, including a camera to use Skype. Samsung TVs have impressed me the last few years. Both with quality of picture and cost. This TV fit the bill. It also is incredibly sleek and was easy to hang on the wall.I've had for it a month now and so far so good. I was especially impressed with the 3D picture!

Reviews.Title: It's amazing !!!
Reviews.Author: Guilherme
Reviews.Content: I really loved this TV and I recommend it to everybody who wants a smartv. The image is very good, the sound is perfect and all interactive functions (motion and voice) work perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Brent Mitchell
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is outstanding and I an very happy with all the features and functions. I would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: SaD4Evr "SaD4Evr"
Reviews.Content: I loved it and i will buy another one bigger size mabye the newest model or maybe the same its depending on the pricw

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46ES7500 46-Inch 1080p 240Hz 3D Slim LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Soundararajan
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this TV a month back. Its worth buying it. The company shipped the item very safely and very quickly.Pros  - Like all Samsung the display is amazing  - Compared to 8 series this 7 series TV can be half rotatable stand  - Excellent 3D Depth. Though couple of reviews which i checked says 3D depth is not good. I would say all those are invalid comments.  - There are new features like hand controlling of screen with out a remote / Voice feature to turn off  on TV  - Easy installation set up and instructionsCons  - Since its Active 3D classes, you may feel eyes are getting tired little bit. But it worth comparing to the 3D experience you'll be getting  - You need to have good wireless keyboard to access the Internet browser  - Hand controlling with out Remote and voice feature to turn off the TV still required more enhancements

Reviews.Title: Excelente tv
Reviews.Author: Marcial Hevertsz
Reviews.Content: excellent product was what I expected the 3D works great easy to use, fast to connect to the cloud, need more variety of applications in the app

Reviews.Title: Holy Mackeral, What a TV!
Reviews.Author: John D. Farr "Johnbbq"
Reviews.Content: We were readey for a Wifi LED television even though we had a perfectly good picture on an old Sharp.  A careful review of the best technology led us to Samsung-----for us this was a 46" slim line LED Wifi TV.  It is just a spectacular color television.  The picture has depth, sharp colors, and you can easily see the grain in the hardwood floor of the basketball court!We are still learning all the possibilities but it has been a long time since I have bought a product that was so great.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Zander
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv to replace my old Toshiba model and I am happy I did. Best Picture quality I've ever seen on a tv, great for movies, and awesome for video games. The best TV I've ever owned hands down.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: jean
Reviews.Content: this tv is the best you can have your sharpness is perfect it sometimes seems that the images are fake as they are perfect ... 3D is very good and it really seems to come out of the screen the images .. I really love this tv is the best you can buy at a great price ... moves the reader is not very good but I imagine that in the future it fixed ... Voice command is great for when you get to the room and talk to the TV and turns on without having to search the control ... Thanks to Amazon and the seller of this tv since arrived on time and in perfect condition

Reviews.Title: Buy it and love it
Reviews.Author: Grant R. Thomas "intewedm"
Reviews.Content: This TV has features that I don't need.  It's easier and more efficient to hook up my laptop to it than to use the browser.  I also don't think I'll ever use the voice/motion controls, but I suppose some games might need them.  I don't play games.  The picture is nothing short of incredible, and the 2D to 3D feature absolutely does work.  I just wish my father were still here to see this.  Our first TV in 1953 was bigger than this with a tiny little black and white screen!  Who can imagine what the future of electronics will be?

Reviews.Title: Great picture and very useful
Reviews.Author: Jenna
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture that almost is too realistic! We love how easy it is to access our Netflix account.  We've only used the 3D mode a few times, but we're not really into 3D.  When we did use it, it worked great, just not a fan of wearing glasses and sitting up right at home.  I also love how the TV appears almost seamless.  It's a very impressive TV and we love it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: C. Rogers "Genius from Concentrate"
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic.  A brilliantly clear picture and top tier technology combine for a great experience.  We have satellite which does provide a nice (1080i at times) picture.  Built-in WiFi is great, especially if you don't have a hard wire connection nearby.This TV replaced another Samsung we had, which was good in its own right (a 6000 series).  The added technology makes the 7500 awesome.  We haven't tried Skype yet, nor have I given the 3D a comparison against the 6000 series. Personally, I will take a significant deficiency in both of those to take anything away from the picture quality and flexibility of picture control this set has.

Reviews.Title: Maybe because I made such a big step up, but I like it
Reviews.Author: John Fredlund
Reviews.Content: The picture is hyper-clear and bright. My wife is after me to change settings to make the picture look more cinematic than as if we were looking through a window at people and scenery. Voice control works so well for me that I don't use much else on the remotes. Gesture control does not work at all, but it seems that would be harder than voice control so why? I read the manual and arranged my inputs as suggested and now it works great as a DVI-HDMI computer monitor. Funnest of all is that I can tell the TV to turn on, tell it to switch to my Samsung DVD-player, and it turns on the DVD player for me. Sound is also good enough that I don't need to run it through my stereo.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Meisterstuck Rollerball Pen
Reviews.Content: installed in living room and hooked into existing surround sound system easily,. Picture is top quality even though we have 14 foot windows facing west and south which get late afternoon sun (part of reason for going with LCD and not plasma for this room). Size was important as it needed to fit into existing TV cabinet built-in, had 1 inch on each side of room after placement. Features are great although the voice and hand control options are pretty useless (they work intermittently even after all software has been updated). Price has come down since July. Skype, Netflix, UTube and other services work well and allow for lots of sourcing options along with DirectTV - would highly recommend. Picture quality is top notch and have not had any pixilation issues with fast moving sports or action scenes.

Reviews.Title: This TV can look at YOU or you can look at it!
Reviews.Author: Skyhawk
Reviews.Content: With the built-in camera, you never really know whether you are looking at the television or the television is looking at you!  Make sure you are properly dressed before getting in front of this thing.Excellent picture, excellent sound, the built-in camera is a tad creepy.  Never could get the hand gesture thing to work very well.Using the remote control is about 10 times easier than the voice control.

Reviews.Title: Great tv!!!
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my bedroom. This TV is awesome!  The TV was delivered on time and was well packaged. The price was much better than any store I looked at and I research everything before I buy! Very Happy.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46ES7500 46 inch 1080P 240HZ 3D Slmit LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: William Pratt
Reviews.Content: This tv has worked great for me!  Use the skype every week to talk to my son miles away.  Camera works great and the colors on the programs have very good colors and detail.

Reviews.Title: Good but having problems with you tube
Reviews.Author: Raja
Reviews.Content: This TV works great except you tube. When you fast forward the video in youtube, It does not forward to that location and sometimes, video is playing without audio. I am not sure if this is the problem with youtube app or TV problem.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Zappato "Zap"
Reviews.Content: Great Picture and so light. 46" TV that weighs a little over 32 pounds.  This has been one of my more excitable purchases due to the LED 240HZ clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Gustavo
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV I've ever had.  The image and sound are simply perfect.  Do not hesitate to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: The tv present  has mal function
Reviews.Author: Katty Azuaje
Reviews.Content: The tv came to my city Valencia-Venezuela yesterday, I tried it at home and has a bad operation, turn off and on constantly. I researched and may have bad power supply, this is not repairable.The tv is not working.

Reviews.Title: SMART TV
Reviews.Author: RENZO RUBERT
Reviews.Content: BROWSER DOES NOT ACT SAME WAY LIKE ON COMPUTER SEEMS LIKE ONLY LIMITED ACESSES AVAILABLE ON WEB BROWSER. DOOR TO INSTRUCTION NOT AVAILABLE. AS FAR AS THE UNIT WORKING ALL APPEARS TO BE IN ORDER BUT WE HAVE A LOT TO LEARN. SHIPPING BOX COULD HAVE BEEN UPGRADED SEEM VERY FLIMSY ALTHOUGH WE DID NOT FIND ANY DAMAGE.

Reviews.Title: If you sell an internet ready device it should be internet ready!
Reviews.Author: elithian "elithian"
Reviews.Content: I have received the television and my initial impression is less than favorable.  This is largely due to the fact it won't do what I purchased it to do; connect to the internet for programming, etc.  I am told by Samsung I need a "linkstick" in order to accomplish this.  They initially gave me one resource for purchasing it but when I called the representative simply stated; "We don't have it".  That was an "authorized Samsung parts supplier".  Then they told me I can buy it on the Samsung website where it is sold for about $80 plus shipping charges.  After some research I have identified a resource where a caompatable device sells for much less but I am not 100% sure either of them will work.  Right now I am seriously considering returning it.  As this unfolds I will update my review.

Reviews.Title: Everything is fine
Reviews.Author: Alejandro
Reviews.Content: I like this screen very much and I recommend it. I haven't test the 3d yet, but everything else works great

Reviews.Title: It's a great TV, but I'd like a bigger one
Reviews.Author: Dio A. Delfino
Reviews.Content: I was torn between this model and LG which was reasonably cheaper when I purchased early 2012. But my friends had recommended Samsung more for its picture quality, name and user experience. In retrospect, I'd still have gone either way.ACTIVE 3DThis was an area I was not really able to compare further since I could only purchase one TV. I did test against the active vs. passive only with previous purchases from my friends (they mostly had the active), and with testing passive at Best Buy. My eyes reacted better with active but would notice a better 'pop-up' figure in the passive 3D provided by LG. In the end, I went with active and Samsung. You could also check this CNET review for reference: [...]BLACK or METALLIC?You could select between this black version from the silver one (UNES7500 vs. UNES8000). The downside with the metallic S8000 is that the metal edge does not seem to be closed very well. There's a noticeable gap in display models I've seen in Best Buy and other known appliance shops. Apart from the better enclosed edges (seamless), the black version also gives you a better way of not noticing the edges since they're black.SCREENI've previously had a Sony XBR3 (circa 2008), and I would say that the size of the Sony XBR and the other older TV versions makes the screen bigger. In this Samsung model which is wider screened and with thinner edges. If I had the chance to buy again, I'd go for at least the 55-inch than this 46-inch model I purchased. But overall, I'm still satisfied, and won't mind purchasing Samsung in the future.SOME DOWNSIDEI did not like how packaging and the delivery was handled via UPS/Amazon. The box was not in good shape, and I only realized that there was a chip in the corner of the TV shortly after delivery. The mere thought of returning such a huge item was a hassle for me. This was why I did not even consider returning it after an inquiry with Amazon customer support. What more is that there has been a free blu-ray player promotion shortly after the purchase. Amazon recommended that I return the purchase to avail of the promo. As a compromise, they gave me a $50 gift card to complement the then USD 79.99 price tag for the Samsung 3d blu ray player.

Reviews.Title: Exelente
Reviews.Author: Roberto Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Excelente televisor  conecta muy bien y eso que tengo aba de CANTV y el Internet es rápido!!! muy buena compra!!

Reviews.Title: came with not working sound....
Reviews.Author: Arunas Ivanauskas
Reviews.Content: Got view but no sound... :( So be cautious if you buy this TV.... I would say Samsung lowered its quality control in order to compete with other companies and it's very bad... Trying to replace this TV or repair.... Other than that: Video is nice, smart options - not so intuitive... Expected more....

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: PEDRO RODRIGUEZ
Reviews.Content: E X C E L L E N T  P R O D U C T,  T H A N K S !!!

Reviews.Title: Bad customer service
Reviews.Author: arbab
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV with a 30 day money back guarantee however on the 10th day after my purchase it was offered with a samsung soundbar worth 200 dollars for the same price I called the customer service to ask them if they would help me with getting the sound bar ( the original speakers on this TV are not that great) as i have just bought this TV they were rude and told me they are unable to help and I even told them that I can always return the TV because of its sound quality and buy another one at the same time with the new offer of sound bar with the TV at the same time but they were not willing to understand my point and even sent me the paperwork to return the TV which I did not use and kept the TV . I hope some higher up will look at this post and compensate me.

ProductInfo.Features:
Smart TV with Smart Interaction
Smart Content with Signature Services
Built-in Wi-Fi and Camera
Full HD 2D and 3D
Thin LED Design: TV with stand (Width x Height x Depth): 41.2-Inch x 27.2-Inch x 10.9-Inch, TV without stand (Width x Height x Depth): 41.2-Inch x 24.4-Inch x 1.2-Inch
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung UN46ES7500 46-Inch 1080p 240Hz 3D Slim LED HDTV (Charcoal Grey) (2012 Model)
